question_text: Which of the following best explains why passive RFID is preferred in environments like retail and manufacturing?
answer_options: It provides the longest range and highest throughput
It allows for two-way encryption by default
It is cheap, low-power, and can be embedded into many objects
It can communicate over Wi-Fi and cellular networks
correct_answer: It is cheap, low-power, and can be embedded into many objects
explanation: Passive RFID tags are low-cost, require no internal battery, and can be placed on a variety of items, making them ideal for mass deployment.
